title: Jean-Luc Godard's final days
description: Last summer, at 91, the film director decided that his time had come. He organized his death by assisted suicide, as authorized by Swiss law. Some of his trusted family and friends speak of the last moments of his life in the small town of Rolle, Switzerland.

title: Argentina: Vice President Cristina Kirchner sentenced to six years in prison for corruption charges
description: Ms. Kirchner has also been sentence a lifetime ban from holding public office for a fraud scheme that embezzled $1 billion through public works projects during her presidency.

title: Gonçalo Ramos scores hat trick as Portugal destroys Switzerland
description: Cristiano Ronaldo's replacement made the most of his opportunity as Portugal cruised past Switerland 6-1 to advance to the World Cup quarterfinals for the third time in history.

title: Trump Organization found guilty of tax fraud
description: A jury found two corporate entities at the Trump Organization guilty on all 17 counts, including conspiracy charges and falsifying business records.

title: Moroccans celebrate historic World Cup win against Spain
description: Fans in the country's capital, in Barcelona, and in Paris, celebrated Morocco's win on Tuesday. It's the only Arab, and African, nation left in the tournament.

title: Meta threatens to remove US news from Facebook
description: Meta has threatened to remove news content from Facebook in the US over a new law that would give news companies more power on social media sites.

title: Europe is struggling to find ways to defend itself from US protectionism
description: The US' Inflation Reduction Act, which aims to curb inflation by reducing the deficit and investing in domestic, clean energy production, is causing great concern in Europe. As a result, the European Commission is seeking ways to fight back.

title: Ronaldo benched for World Cup match against Switzerland
description: Cristiano Ronaldo was left out of Portugal's starting line-up with Goncalo Ramos selected up front at his expense.

title: COP15 biodiversity summit offers chance of 'Paris-style agreement' for nature
description: The UN Biodiversity Conference beginning on Wednesday in Montreal is supposed to adopt a new global framework to protect nature and prevent a sixth mass extinction.

title: Morocco knock out Spain on penalties to reach historic World Cup quarter-final
description: Achraf Hakimi, who was born in Madrid to Moroccan parents, struck the decisive penalty, sending Morocco into the World Cup quarter-finals for the first time.

title: 'Atlanta' delivers a sentimental and demanding finale
description: A cult phenomenon, the series that explores what it means to be Black in modern times is closing with a fourth season reviving the spirit of its origins.

title: In China, photographers at Jimei x Arles festival ask, where is home?
description: The eighth edition of the International Photography Festival opened its doors in Xiamen, China, amid health restrictions that drastically reduced the number of potential visitors.

title: Brussels attacks: Defendants protest security conditions, threatening progress of trial
description: The 10 defendants denounced the conditions of their detention on the first day of the trial over the attacks that killed 32 people in March 2016.

title: Annie Ernaux, French Nobel Laureate, says men must change attitudes now
description: The writer of 'The Years' and 'A Woman's Story' said if men 'do not become aware of their way of life, no real liberation for women will happen.'

title: Belgium hopes for quick deportation of on-the-run imam to France
description: Hassan Iquioussen is under surveillance in France, which wants him to be deported to Morocco, where he is a citizen.

title: Systematic torture in the Ukrainian city of Kherson during the Russian occupation
description: After the withdrawal of Moscow's forces from the region, residents have begun to give a horrifying account of the abuses to which they were systematically subjected.

title: UK court: Juan Carlos had immunity from claims while king of Spain
description: His former mistress is acccusing him of a 'continuous and ongoing campaign of harassment.'

title: Macron attempts to reassure France over possible power cuts
description: The French president urged people 'not to panic,' claiming power outtages could be avoided if usage was reduced.

title: World Cup 2022: Morocco-Spain, a round of 16 with the appearance of a derby
description: Morocco will face Spain on Tuesday, with the Atlas Lions hoping to reach the World Cup quarterfinals for the first time.

title: At WWII internment camp, Macron calls for 'resistance to the spiral' of racist and anti-Semitic hatred
description: The French president visited the site of the Camp des Milles in southern France, where 2,000 Jews were deported to Auschwitz-Birkenau in 1942.

title: Record sales, poor reputation – the Tesla paradox
description: The US automaker led by billionaire Elon Musk is on a roll on the back of growing demand for its electrical vehicles but recalls are also on the rise

title: Nicolas Sarkozy appears in court: 'I have never corrupted anyone'
description: The former French president, his lawyer Thierry Herzog and former judge Gilbert Azibert are being tried on appeal for corruption and influence peddling.

title: EU bans import of products that are 'main drivers of deforestation'
description: These include cattle, coffee, cocoa, palm oil, rubber, soy and timber.

title: Former magistrate Renaud Van Ruymbeke: 'EU must return to the drawing board on financial transparency and tax havens'
description: A new Court of Justice of the European Union ruling limiting access to information regarding the register of EU company beneficiaries must not hinder the fight against money laundering.

title: 'Only yes means yes': Swiss parliament begins process to broaden limited rape definition
description: Swiss law still does not define rape on the basis of lack of consent. Instead, it uses a definition based on whether physical violence, threat or coercion is involved, reports Amnesty International.

title: World Cup 2022: In Doha, Brazilian fans pay tribute to 'King' Pelé
description: The news of the legendary player’s worsening health created a special atmosphere in Qatar when Brazil qualified for the semi-finals after beating South Korea.

title: Our climate is changing. Will our bodies do the same?
description: Shorter nights, increased vulnerability to certain diseases, disruptions throughout women's hormonal cycle are high on the list of the modifications coming as a result of planet Earth's climate changing.

title: World Cup 2022: 'Video-assisted refereeing subjects goals to conditions, as well as emotions'
description: In its hunt for errors that have become intolerable, VAR has turned its operators into bailiffs measuring offsides to the centimeter and adopting a binary logic: everything that is observed is sanctioned.

title: All you ever wanted to know about the 'Twitter Files'
description: Elon Musk, Twitter's sultry new chairman intends to demonstrate his predecessors' obstruction of free speech – and of Donald Trump's 2020 presidential campaign.

title: Georgia runoff Senate race: Trump-backed candidate claims God is on his side
description: Herschel Walker, the Republican candidate in the December 6 election, is on the road to redemption, despite his many blunders.

title: 'Salah Hamouri must be released on December 6!'
description: Six French MPs from left-wing party La France Insoumise call for the release of the French-Palestinian lawyer Salah Hamouri, who is being held by Israel in administrative detention. On December 6, a new hearing will be held to decide whether he should be deported to France.

title: Two-time Emmy winner Kirstie Alley dies at 71
description: The actress, star of both big and small screens, died on Monday, December 5, 2022, after a brief battle with cancer.

title: World Cup 2022: Harry Maguire, a certain version of English football
description: Much criticized at Manchester United, the defender has once again asserted himself in the England team, which easily defeated Senegal in the round of 16 on Sunday.
